title: ENR and subscription errors when re-subscribing with --subscribe-all-subnets
body:
## Description

When using `--subscribe-all-subnets` there seem to be issues updating the ENR when the node drops in and out of sync. It seems that we do a bunch of subscriptions the first time after we sync, and then re-attempt the same subscriptions when sync is attained again, causing the duplicate ENR issues.

This is likely just an issue of logging. There's no indication that this impacts correctness.

```
Sep 01 10:16:53.000 INFO Synced                                  slot: 1969282, block:    …  empty, epoch: 61540, finalized_epoch: 61538, finalized_root: 0xa810…5f44, peers: 18, service: slot_notifier

```

Yes. This is actually by design (not the error logging of course). 

I decided that when we drop out of sync, we shouldn't unsubscribe from topics, to prevent any kind of attack which tricks us into thinking we should be syncing again and prevent us from participating in gossip. 

The resolution to this issue is to either not attempt to re-subscribe if we are already subscribed, but the better solution, I think is to just not print any warnings or errors if we are already subscribed. 

The CRIT's IIRC were there to find edge cases (which this is).

This should only occur if you drop out of sync after being fully synced. 

This is supposed to be pretty difficult to do, unless you like stop your internet connection for an epoch or something. 

How did you manage this @michaelsproul?

> How did you manage this @michaelsproul?

Sorry, failed to mention that I used checkpoint sync :sweat_smile: I think I might have been turning my node on and off pretty rapidly. Tried to reproduce now and got this error instead:

```
Sep 20 15:38:30.147 INFO Backfill sync paused                    reason: insufficient_synced_peers, service: sync
Sep 20 15:38:30.147 INFO Sync state updated                      new_state: Synced, old_state: Syncing Historical Blocks, service: sync
Sep 20 15:38:30.197 INFO UPnP UDP route established              external_socket: nahbruv:9111:9111, service: UPnP
Sep 20 15:38:31.712 ERRO Backfill sync failed                    error: InvalidSyncState("Batch not found for current processing target 65709"), service: sync
Sep 20 15:38:31.712 ERRO Backfill sync failed to start           error: InvalidSyncState("Batch not found for current processing target 65709"), service: sync
```

Although it recovered almost immediately.
Oh yeah. Thats a backfill sync bug. It should recover, but it shouldn't hit those errors. Will look into it

@michaelsproul - I've added a commit to the `weak-subjectivity-sync` PR which I think should help handle this. 

Could you try your funky behaviour again to see if it is resolved.
Yeah that seems to have fixed it. Will close this for now

Want to keep this open to track the issue for the CRIT and WARN logs when we try to resubscribe. 
I believe @pawanjay176 is going to correct these logs.
